intro: Fibigia clypeata var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed fibigia, is a variant of the fibigia clypeata species, characterized by its obovate leaf shape. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are often pink or red in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The leaves are usually large, broad, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
